## Goal

Analyze development indicators across countries (2022):

- GDP per capita
- Life expectancy
- Total population

## Load Data

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df.shape
```

## GDP vs Life Expectancy

```{python}
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.ylabel("Life expectancy (years)")
plt.title("GDP per capita vs Life Expectancy")
plt.show()
```

## Top 10 Countries by Population

```{python}
top10 = df.sort_values("total_population", ascending=False).head(10)

plt.figure()
plt.bar(top10["country"], top10["total_population"])
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.xlabel("Country")
plt.ylabel("Population")
plt.title("Top 10 Countries by Population")
plt.show()
```

## Takeaways

- Higher GDP per capita often aligns with higher life expectancy (overall trend)
- Population is concentrated in a small number of countries
